Vehicles.VehicleBuildDef.label: Renault Type K
Vehicles.VehicleBuildDef.description:
The Renault Type K, produced in 1902, was a significant early automobile that gained fame for its victory in the 1902 Paris-Vienna race. Designed by the Renault brothers, it featured a four-cylinder engine, which was advanced for its time, delivering more power and speed than many contemporary vehicles.

Consumes a lot of fuel, and is best used for short to medium distances.

<color=#bb8f04>Crew:</color> Driver x1, Passenger x1
<color=#bb8f04>Fuel type:</color> Chemfuel
